title: Kobold level
data:
The **kobold level** is a special level that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is where [Kroo the Kobold King](/wiki/Kroo_the_Kobold_King "Kroo the Kobold King") dwells among several other kobolds - in SlashTHEM, he is joined by [clerical](/wiki/Clerical "Clerical") spellcaster [Krooella the Kobold Queen](/index.php?title=Krooella_the_Kobold_Queen\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Krooella the Kobold Queen (page does not exist)").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Map](#Map)

  - [2.1 Corridors](#Corridors)
  - [2.2 Town](#Town)

- [3 See also](#See_also)

- [4 Reference](#Reference)

## Generation

In SLASH'EM, the kobold level appears in 1⁄2 of games, and is located on dungeon level 11 or 12.

## Map

There are two variants of the kobold map: one is a normal random room-and-corridors map, and the other looks a bit like a town map.

### Corridors

In the room-and-corridors map, four of its rooms contain two random [k](/wiki/Kobold_\(monster_class\) "Kobold (monster class)") each, and one contains four random ​k. Kroo's room contains three [large kobolds](/wiki/Large_kobold "Large kobold"), two [kobold lords](/wiki/Kobold_lord "Kobold lord"), three [swamp kobolds](/wiki/Swamp_kobold "Swamp kobold"), and Kroo himself. Kroo's space contains two random weapons, a random wand, two random pieces of armor, and two random potions, and the room contains four chests, placed at random.

### Town

Below is a map of the "town" variant of the Kobold level. The other variant is a randomly generated rooms-and-corridors level.

   
\|--------------------------------------    -------------------|  ----|  
|.123|...|.|...|......|.|......|......|----|............[+](/wiki/Door "Door").....[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")##[+](/wiki/Door "Door").[s](/wiki/Giant_spider "Giant spider").|  
|[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")---|...|.[+](/wiki/Door "Door")...|......|.[+](/wiki/Door "Door")......|......|....|.|---[+](/wiki/Door "Door")------|.....|  |..4|  
|....|...[+](/wiki/Door "Door").|...|......[+](/wiki/Door "Door").|......|......|....[+](/wiki/Door "Door").|..|.......|.....|  |---|  
|....|...|.|...|......|.|......|......|....|.|..--|.....|.....[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")####     
\|--[+](/wiki/Door "Door")------[+](/wiki/Door "Door")------------[+](/wiki/Door "Door")----------[+](/wiki/Door "Door")---------.[+](/wiki/Door "Door")....|.....---[+](/wiki/Door "Door")--|   #     
|......................[<](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase")|.....|..............|....|.....|.....|   ###   
|[+](/wiki/Door "Door")--------------------|.|.....[+](/wiki/Door "Door").|---[+](/wiki/Door "Door")-----[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")------------[+](/wiki/Door "Door")|.....|     #   
|.......[+](/wiki/Door "Door").[+](/wiki/Door "Door").....|.....|.|.....|.|......|  #           |.|.....|     #   
|.---[+](/wiki/Door "Door")---.|----.[+](/wiki/Door "Door").....|.|.....|.|......|  ##          |.[+](/wiki/Door "Door").....|     #   
|.|.....|.|...|.|.....|.-------.|------|   #          |.|.....|  ####   
|.|.....|.[+](/wiki/Door "Door")...|[+](/wiki/Door "Door")|-----|.|...|...|....|     [B](/wiki/Rhumbat "Rhumbat")##        |[+](/wiki/Door "Door")------|  #      
|.|-----|.|...|.......|.|...|.|-|....|     ##6        |.......| |[+](/wiki/Door "Door")--|   
|.|.....|.|...|.......|.|...|.[+](/wiki/Door "Door")[#](/wiki/Sink "Sink")|....|                |.......| |7..|   
|.|.....|.----|...5[>](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase")..|.--[+](/wiki/Door "Door")--.-----[+](/wiki/Door "Door")------------------|.......| |...|   
|.[+](/wiki/Door "Door").....|.....[+](/wiki/Door "Door").......[+](/wiki/Door "Door")..............[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")................[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door").......| |---|   
\|--------------------------------------------------------------       

The # in the enclosed room in the southern portion represents a sink rather than a corridor. Scattered throughout the level are 3 random traps, 7 random piles of gold, 30 [kobolds](/wiki/Kobold "Kobold") and 5 random ​k. Each room contains the following:

- 1, 2, and 3 are chests containing random loot.
- 4 contains a pile of gold, three gems, and a chest with random loot.
- 5 contains a throne, a wand, two potions, two weapons, two pieces of armor, and a chest with random loot. Kroo the Kobold King is in this room, along with 3 large kobolds, 3 swamp kobolds, 2 [rock kobolds](/wiki/Rock_kobold "Rock kobold"), 2 [kobold shamans](/wiki/Kobold_shaman "Kobold shaman"), and 6 random ​k.
- 6 contains a pile of gold, 2 gems, a wand, and a chest with random loot.
- 7 contains a [rhumbat](/wiki/Rhumbat "Rhumbat") guarding a pile of gold, 3 gems, and a chest with random loot.

## See also

- [Special level (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Special_level_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Special level (SLASH'EM)")

## Reference

html:
Kobold level

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The kobold level is a special level that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. It is where Kroo the Kobold King dwells among several other kobolds - in SlashTHEM, he is joined by clerical spellcaster Krooella the Kobold Queen.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Map
    • 2.1 Corridors
    • 2.2 Town
  • 3 See also
  • 4 Reference

Generation

In SLASH'EM, the kobold level appears in 1⁄2 of games, and is located on dungeon level 11 or 12.

Map

There are two variants of the kobold map: one is a normal random room-and-corridors map, and the other looks a bit like a town map.

Corridors

In the room-and-corridors map, four of its rooms contain two random k each, and one contains four random ​k. Kroo's room contains three large kobolds, two kobold lords, three swamp kobolds, and Kroo himself. Kroo's space contains two random weapons, a random wand, two random pieces of armor, and two random potions, and the room contains four chests, placed at random.

Town

Below is a map of the "town" variant of the Kobold level. The other variant is a randomly generated rooms-and-corridors level.

 
|--------------------------------------    -------------------|  ----|
|.123|...|.|...|......|.|......|......|----|............+.....S##+.s.|

|.|.....|.|...|.|.....|.-------.|------|   #          |.|.....|  #### 
|.|.....|.+...|+|-----|.|...|...|....|     B##        |+------|  #    
|.|-----|.|...|.......|.|...|.|-|....|     ##6        |.......| |+--| 
|.|.....|.|...|.......|.|...|.+#|....|                |.......| |7..|

|.+.....|.....+.......+..............S................S.......| |---| 
|--------------------------------------------------------------       

The # in the enclosed room in the southern portion represents a sink rather than a corridor. Scattered throughout the level are 3 random traps, 7 random piles of gold, 30 kobolds and 5 random ​k. Each room contains the following:

  • 1, 2, and 3 are chests containing random loot.
  • 4 contains a pile of gold, three gems, and a chest with random loot.
  • 5 contains a throne, a wand, two potions, two weapons, two pieces of armor, and a chest with random loot. Kroo the Kobold King is in this room, along with 3 large kobolds, 3 swamp kobolds, 2 rock kobolds, 2 kobold shamans, and 6 random ​k.
  • 6 contains a pile of gold, 2 gems, a wand, and a chest with random loot.
  • 7 contains a rhumbat guarding a pile of gold, 3 gems, and a chest with random loot.

See also

  • Special level (SLASH'EM)

rawPage:
The '''kobold level''' is a special level that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is where [[Kroo the Kobold King]] dwells among several other kobolds - in SlashTHEM, he is joined by [[clerical]] spellcaster [[Krooella the Kobold Queen]]. ==Generation== In SLASH'EM, the kobold level appears in {{frac|2}} of games, and is located on dungeon level 11 or 12. ==Map== There are two variants of the kobold map: one is a normal random room-and-corridors map, and the other looks a bit like a town map. ===Corridors=== In the room-and-corridors map, four of its rooms contain two random {{mcsl|k}} each, and one contains four random {{monclasssym|k}}. Kroo's room contains three [[large kobold]]s, two [[kobold lord]]s, three [[swamp kobold]]s, and Kroo himself. Kroo's space contains two random weapons, a random wand, two random pieces of armor, and two random potions, and the room contains four chests, placed at random. ===Town=== Below is a map of the "town" variant of the Kobold level. The other variant is a randomly generated rooms-and-corridors level.

The {{gray|#}} in the enclosed room in the southern portion represents a sink rather than a corridor. Scattered throughout the level are 3 random traps, 7 random piles of gold, 30 [[kobold]]s and 5 random {{monclasssym|k}}. Each room contains the following: * 1, 2, and 3 are chests containing random loot. * 4 contains a pile of gold, three gems, and a chest with random loot. * 5 contains a throne, a wand, two potions, two weapons, two pieces of armor, and a chest with random loot. Kroo the Kobold King is in this room, along with 3 large kobolds, 3 swamp kobolds, 2 [[rock kobold]]s, 2 [[kobold shaman]]s, and 6 random {{monclasssym|k}}. * 6 contains a pile of gold, 2 gems, a wand, and a chest with random loot. * 7 contains a [[rhumbat]] guarding a pile of gold, 3 gems, and a chest with random loot. ==See also== * [[Special level (SLASH'EM)]] ==Reference== from kobold-2.des file {{slashem-7E7}} [[Category:SLASH'EM special levels]] [[Category:SlashTHEM special levels]] [[Category:Hack'EM special levels]]
